results.title: Association between metformin use and reduced short- and long-term all-cause mortality in patients undergoing cardiac surgery: a retrospective cohort study.
results.text_hl: A higher proportion of individuals who received @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ following surgery were male (75.6% vs 72.3%, P = 0.01), younger (67.19 +- 9.26 vs 67.95 +- 11.75, P = 0.006), and had lower Sequential @<m>DISEASE_Multiple_Organ_Failure</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009102 @@@Organ Failure@@@ Assessment Scores (4.92 +- 2.38 vs 5.31 +- 2.79, P < 0.001).

citations.NLM: Chen B, Tai Y, Kong Y, Wang C. Association between metformin use and reduced short- and long-term all-cause mortality in patients undergoing cardiac surgery: a retrospective cohort study. Eur J Med Res. 2025 Jul 9;30(1):606. PMID: 40635110

results.title: Metformin use in patients hospitalized with COVID-19: lower inflammation, oxidative stress, and thrombotic risk markers and better clinical outcomes
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patients@@@ on @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ compared to naive @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ had a lower white blood cell count (p = 0.02), d-dimer (p = 0.04), urinary @CHEMICAL_11_dehydro_thromboxane_B2 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C049235 @@@11-dehydro thromboxane B2@@@ (p = 0.01) and urinary @GENE_FABP1 @GENE_2168 @@@liver-type fatty acid binding protein@@@ (p = 0.03) levels and had lower sequential @<m>DISEASE_Multiple_Organ_Failure</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009102 @@@organ failure@@@ assessment score (p = 0.002), and intubation rate (p = 0.03), fewer hospitalized days (p = 0.13), lower in-hospital mortality (p = 0.12) and lower mortality plus nonfatal @DISEASE_Thrombosis @DISEASE_MESH:D013927 @@@thrombotic@@@ event occurrences (p = 0.10).

citations.NLM: Usman A, Bliden KP, Cho A, Walia N, Jerjian C, Singh A, Kundan P, Duhan S, Tantry US, Gurbel PA. Metformin use in patients hospitalized with COVID-19: lower inflammation, oxidative stress, and thrombotic risk markers and better clinical outcomes J Thromb Thrombolysis. 2022 Feb;53(2):363-371. PMID: 35041121

results.title: Successful rescue of a rare case of refractory shock due to multidrug toxicity: a case report.
results.text_hl: Introduction: This article reports the successful treatment experience of refractory @DISEASE_Shock @DISEASE_MESH:D012769 @@@shock@@@, @DISEASE_Acidosis @DISEASE_MESH:D000138 @@@acidosis@@@, @DISEASE_Hypoglycemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007003 @@@hypoglycemia@@@, and @<m>DISEASE_Multiple_Organ_Failure</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009102 @@@multi-organ failure@@@ after @DISEASE_Drug_Overdose @DISEASE_MESH:D062787 @@@overdose@@@ of @CHEMICAL_Reserpine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D012110 @@@reserpine@@@, @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, and aims to provide a reference for the rescue of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with such @DISEASE_Poisoning @DISEASE_MESH:D011041 @@@poisoning@@@.

citations.NLM: Xie Y, Zhou Y, Cao Y. Successful rescue of a rare case of refractory shock due to multidrug toxicity: a case report. Front Pharmacol. 2025;16():1669831. PMID: 40963686
citations.BibTeX: @article{40963686, title={Successful rescue of a rare case of refractory shock due to multidrug toxicity: a case report.}, author={Xie Y and Zhou Y and Cao Y}, journal={Front Pharmacol}, volume={16}, pages={1669831}}

results.title: Donohue syndrome with a homozygous INSR exon 14 deletion: a case report.
results.text_hl: Despite treatment with @CHEMICAL_Octreotide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015282 @@@octreotide@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, and @CHEMICAL_maltodextrin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C008315 @@@maltodextrin@@@, the @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@'s condition worsened, leading to @DISEASE_Shock_Septic @DISEASE_MESH:D012772 @@@septic shock@@@, @DISEASE_Disseminated_Intravascular_Coagulation @DISEASE_MESH:D004211 @@@disseminated intravascular coagulation@@@, and @<m>DISEASE_Multiple_Organ_Failure</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009102 @@@multiple organ failure@@@.

citations.NLM: Almazán Monroy JD, Valle Martinez AJ, Milla Salguero SE, Perdomo Domínguez ES. Donohue syndrome with a homozygous INSR exon 14 deletion: a case report. Oxf Med Case Reports. 2025 Sep;2025(9):omaf183. PMID: 41025026

results.title: Metformin Exerts Beneficial Effects in Hemorrhagic Shock in An AMPKalpha1-Independent Manner.
results.text_hl: Compared with vehicle-treated WT animals, KO animals exhibited a more severe @DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@hypotension@@@, higher @DISEASE_Lung_Injury @DISEASE_MESH:D055370 @@@lung and liver injury@@@ and neutrophil infiltration, and higher levels of plasma inflammatory cytokines. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ treatment ameliorated @<m>DISEASE_Multiple_Organ_Failure</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009102 @@@organ injury@@@ and mean arterial blood pressure in both WT and KO @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@, without affecting systemic cytokine levels.

citations.NLM: Kim P, Piraino G, O'Connor M, Hake PW, Wolfe V, Lahni P, Zingarelli B. Metformin Exerts Beneficial Effects in Hemorrhagic Shock in An AMPKalpha1-Independent Manner. Shock. 2018 Mar;49(3):277-287. PMID: 28915221

results.title: Metformin-associated lactic acidosis: case reports and literature review.
results.text_hl: A young @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@non-diabetic@@@ female who had taken a large dose of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ to commit suicide died from @<m>DISEASE_Multiple_Organ_Failure</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009102 @@@multiple organ failure@@@ despite aggressive treatment.

citations.NLM: Chang CT, Chen YC, Fang JT, Huang CC. Metformin-associated lactic acidosis: case reports and literature review. J Nephrol. 2002 Jul-Aug;15(4):398-402. PMID: 12243370
